title: Didn't Hai have problems with his wrists? How is he able to play with FlyQuest now?
body: I thought he was permanently damaged and he would never be able to properly play the game again. What happened? I'm so glad he's back though, FlyQuest has quickly become my favourite team in all of Esports ( except for the retarded name ofc ).

replies.body:
Who needs wrists when you've got swag
https://www.reddit.com/r/Cloud9/comments/3jzz6b/caption_this_shot_of_hai_at_the_playboy_mansion/

He's been healed enough since around season 5, he had stopped because he didn't enjoy dealing with the whole " C9 is NA's last hope" pressure thing. 

So now no one expects anything so he cant just have fun 

Sources come from His first interview of season after first series against envy and one of his streams.

Everyone needs a vacation of sorts sometimes- And he even put his on chill for a while to bail c9 out from relegations lol. Dudes practically an icon in NA right now for clutch games at the last possible time.

With enough downtime and exercise, and posture/etc, you can fix problems like that. Its not a death sentence. It was honestly overblown for "ratings" anyways. Half the people in the world deal with tendonitis in various forms. There is a reason stuff is called "tennis elbow" etc. You just get it. And considering he probably had access to excellent therapists/doctors/knowledgeable people, he worked through it WAY faster than your average person would have.

Younger generation people don't have issues like that, so when you hear "omg something wrong iwth his wrists!" you assume guy is in a bodycast and can barely do anything and is fubar'd. Where later in life when you are older you are going to be like, well he had tendonitis, lol. Eat some Advil and man up.
He just needed time away to let them heal.
